content.description:
A Visit from a God

Huic1 se forma dei vultu redeuntis eodem 
obtulitoffero, offerre, obtuli: to present in somnis, rursusque ita visa monere est– 
omnia MercurioMercurius, -i, m.: Mercury (the god) similis, vocemque coloremcolor, -oris, m.: colorque 
et crinescrinis, -is, m. = coma, -ae flavosflavus, -a, -um, adj.: golden et membra decoradecorus, -a, -um, adj.: handsome iuventaeiuventa, -ae, f.: youth.
 1:refers to Aeneas↩
content.question: The metrical pattern of the first four feet of line 2 (obtulit...est) is

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2

skill.text: 2.A: Describe features and functions of stylistic elements in Latin texts.
